result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Argelio A. Benitez-Broches

defendant.name: Benitez-Broches, Argelio A.

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Cases 22CT115 & 22CF246 called at 2:24pm 
Defendant Argelio A Benitez-Broches in court.  Attorney Michael Reyes in court for Argelio A Benitez-Broches.  Attorney Michael C. Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant. 

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing occurs in Case 22CF246: 
Mr. Benitez-Broches waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

recess: 2:29pm  

NEXT:  Arraignment(22CF246)/Status Conference(22CT115) on 12/5/22 at 3:00pm
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; to take prescription medications only as prescribed

[ae] case called 11:08 AM Defendant Argelio A. Benitez-Broches in court with attorney Michael Reyes. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Spanish Interpreter Ryan remains under oath.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; to take prescription medications only as prescribed

Defendant is to report for booking today
recess 11:13 am
